column5: Hi all,  my spring walleye tip is to make sure your auger blades are sharp.....lol.   Lots of ice here still, and a local lake that sucked for fishing the last few years has come alive again, its about a 20 minute drive down the trails from my house so makes a good destination once the kid is off the bus now we have daylight till 8pm.  Hit this spot up a few times in the last 2 weeks, here is the first video I made.
~~~Thanks for sharing, great vid for a Monday morning at my work desk
nice fish. good video liked it better when the bell wasnt on the end of the rod. lol
thanks for sharing -  i too enjoyed it better when the bell was off     but it was a pleasant break from my work/office day either way watching your adventure.  thanks.
Everytime a bell rings, Simon gets his fins.  I wish you would post a white fish slam bud.
Thanks for that, Simon. An entertaining/refreshing post indeed. Hey, it's a fishing thread...I don't care how many bells there are.
